stadium.name: The High-Pass Pitch
stadium.description: A field built at a breathtaking altitude in a fortified mountain pass. The air is painfully thin, and the weather is dangerously unpredictable.

stats.pregame_ritual: Tying a small, hand-carved wooden bird to their gear.
Slapping their own helmet until their ears ring.
Avoiding eye contact with anyone wearing the color green.
Sharing a ceremonial, non-alcoholic grog from a communal cup.
Whispering a secret fear to the Trollball before the game.
Reciting their grocery list backward to clear their mind.
Dipping their hands in a bucket of ice-cold well water.
Asking a teammate to tell them a story, but only the beginning.
Exchanging well-wishes with their direct opponent before the game starts.
Singing a sea shanty completely out of tune.
Getting a teammate to punch them in the shoulder, hard.

stadium.name: The Oakmaul Grounds
stadium.description: Built over the site of the final battle during the liberation of Hafting now rises The Oakmaul Grounds—part arena, part monument. The central oak still bears the burn scars of the final battle. Troll ball here feels more like ritual than sport.

stats.pregame_ritual: Wiggling their fingers in a complex, magical-looking pattern.
Tying their bootlaces together and hopping to the starting line.
Attempting to communicate with birds.
Chewing a specific, bitter root said to improve night vision.
Plucking a single hair from a teammate's beard for luck.
Rubbing the Trollball on their armpits for 'grip'.
Organizing a small betting pool on who will score first.
Asking the Trollball for advice, and pretending to listen to its response.
Smelling their own game-worn socks from the previous match.
Anointing their forehead with morning dew.
Performing a series of aggressive, theatrical poses.

preGame: Greetings, sports fans! This is Nok the Corrupter coming to you live from the High-Pass Pitch for a playoff opener that'll make your head spin—literally! We are perched high in Oread's Summit where the air is thinner than a goblin's promise and the vertigo is starting to kick in! It is Game 1 of a Best of 3 series between The Greenwatch and The Oread's Summit Tamers, and the playoff atmosphere is absolutely chilling! I see Madea Mensch over there tying his bootlaces together and hopping like a deranged rabbit to the starting line! Talk about a high-stakes strategy! Meanwhile, Rese Halpern is taking deep, soulful whiffs of her game-worn socks from the last match. That is the scent of destiny, folks, or perhaps just advanced foot rot! Over on the Tamers' side, Odericus Juxon is slapping her own helmet until her ears ring—that is the kind of self-inflicted violence I love to see before the whistle even blows! Edme Virgil is warming up by singing a sea shanty completely out of tune, which is probably more effective at disorienting the opposition than any magic spell. The stands might be a bit thin since the Tamers aren't exactly the most popular bunch in Osterra, but the stakes couldn't be higher! The loser of this series gets a one-way ticket to the loser's bracket. Sir Randy and his fancy bow won't be able to save The Greenwatch if they can't handle this altitude! Let's get to the carnage!
postGame: What a spectacular display of grit, exhaustion, and beautiful, beautiful violence! We went the distance and then some today, folks, in a game that proved why Trollball is the only sport worth dying for! The first half was a real comedy of errors with more missed tackles than a blind ogre in a china shop. Darin Berliner grabbed the ball early for the Greenwatch, but the thin air seemed to be getting to everyone's heads! We saw Verne Methuselah, Alwyn Wandy, and Kass Fogel all swinging at air like they were fighting invisible ghosts. It was a scoreless stalemate going into the break, but the healers had their work cut out for them regardless! Halftime came and went, and all those exhausted players were dragged back onto the pitch for more punishment. I was worried we wouldn't see any real bone-crushing action, but Verne Methuselah finally delivered the goods! She absolutely hammered Zadoc Wyatan into the dirt, leaving them injured and requiring a trip to the sidelines! Now that is the kind of playoff intensity I crave! Not to be outdone, Troy Jorgan decided to play architect and use Edme Virgil's face as the foundation for a new crater in the Away Field! Another injury for the books! The Greenwatch was playing for keeps, but their offense was as shaky as a newborn fawn. The 'heroes' of the Wardens must be weeping in their tea over this one, because despite the physical dominance, the scoreboard remained empty. Rese Halpern threw a wild pass that looked more like a desperate prayer, only for Dric Trilley to snatch it out of the air like a hungry hawk! What an interception! But the fumbles continued, with Mitran Mariand dropping a pass that should have been an easy score. We headed into Overtime with lungs burning and the blizzard conditions picking up! The tension was thicker than the walls of the Demon Prison! Finally, the moment of truth arrived in the sudden death period. Mitran Mariand secured the ball in the Away Field, and the defense finally buckled under the pressure. Swamy Ahasuerus took the initiative, found a gap, and instead of running for a touchdown, she channeled her inner demon and let it fly! Swoosh! A two-point shoot right through the goal from distance! The Oread's Summit Tamers walk away with a 2 to 0 victory in this first playoff match! The Tamers might have zero popularity in the polls, but they have one massive win where it counts! The Greenwatch better start praying to the morning dew or whatever it is they do, because they are now one game away from the loser's bracket. I haven't seen this much disappointment on a 'hero's' face since Sir Tanos realized I was the one announcing his matches! What a day for the High-Pass Pitch!
